tracks.title: Three Girls
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, theatrical female soprano fracturing into three distinct vocal personalities, shifting between them mid-phrase
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, fractured art-rock with Honor's Theme hymn-like melody split into three competing variations in canon, shifting time signatures representing identity fragments, theatrical female vocals with personality shifts, concept album continuity, theatrical, identity crisis in music
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Shallan draws the world the way she wants,
Veil walks the underworld and calmly taunts,
Radiant stands with posture, poise, and blade,
Three girls wearing masks that Shallan made.

[verse 2]
Which one is real? The one who hides in art?
The one who fights? The one who plays the part?
Pattern buzzes, "Mmm, a lie, a lie,"
Three versions of a girl who'd rather die
Than face the truth of what she did at ten,
The blade, the mother, never speak again.

[chorus]
Three girls, three masks, three ways to run,
From the one true Shallan underneath the sun,
She fractures like a gemstone, cracked and bright,
Each piece pretending that she's doing right.

[bridge]
The honor theme, but played in three-part round,
Each version slightly off, a fractured sound,
They harmonize, they clash, they cannot stay,
In tune, and something's got to give someday.

[verse 3]
Veil says, "Forget." Radiant says, "Stand firm."
And Shallan, little Shallan, starts to squirm,
She draws another face, another name,
Another mask to play another's game.

[outro]
Three girls, one body, one terrified heart,
Coming together, falling apart.

tracks.title: Honor Is Dead
tracks.voice_instruct: A raw, emotionally intense male baritone at his lowest point, bitter and defeated but with one stubborn ember of defiance that refuses to die
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, sparse acoustic desolation, deliberate silence where Honor's Theme should play, building to single piano note at the end echoing the hymn, minimal arrangement, isolated male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the lowest point before the climb
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
They threw me in a cell for standing tall,
For daring to protect, for crossing walls
Between the lighteyes and the darkeyed ranks,
And this is how the world returns its thanks.

[verse 2]
The arena duel, I jumped to save a prince,
And every lighteyes wants my head ever since,
Elhokar, the king, he wanted me to die,
For the crime of honor, what a lie.

[chorus]
Honor is dead, I'll see what I can do,
Honor is dead, and I am dying too,
But somewhere in the ashes of the phrase,
A stubborn ember refuses to be razed.

[bridge]
Syl is gone, or nearly, barely there,
A spren of honor in a world that doesn't care,
The cistern fills with water, dark and cold,
And I am so tired of being brave and bold.

[verse 3]
But the men of Bridge Four stand outside my door,
Rock and Teft and Sigzil, they implore,
"Captain, captain, we're still here, we're still yours,"
And something, one small note, begins to thaw the floors.

[outro]
Honor is dead, but I, I am not,
Not yet, not yet, not yet, I am not.

tracks.title: The Scholar's Oath
tracks.voice_instruct: A commanding, precise female mezzo-soprano with intellectual authority, measured delivery like a lecturer who could also command armies, cool and controlled with hidden passion
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, intellectual progressive rock with Honor's Theme hymn-like melody as intellectual variation on harpsichord and cello, complex time signatures, precise female vocals, baroque-influenced arrangements, concept album continuity, theatrical, character introduction
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
While soldiers swing their Blades and call it art,
I wage my war with logic, mind, and heart,
The Voidbringers are coming, this I know,
Because the evidence has told me so.

[verse 2]
My mother called me heretic and wrong,
An atheist who doesn't sing the song,
But I have read what others will not read,
And I have pulled the truth from history's seed.

[chorus]
The scholar's oath is this: I will not turn
From any truth, no matter how it burns,
I'll follow where the evidence will lead,
Through heresy and exile, word and deed.

[bridge]
Honor's melody on cello, dark and slow,
An intellectual variation, measured, low,
Not a battle cry, but something just as strong,
The quiet oath to prove the world is wrong.

[verse 3]
Shallan was my ward, my student, my mistake,
I should have seen the cracks about to break,
But I was buried in my research deep,
And now the Desolation wakes from sleep.

[outro]
Let them call me cold, let them call me vain,
The scholar's oath remains through every pain.

tracks.title: Ivory Tower
tracks.voice_instruct: A commanding, precise female mezzo-soprano with intellectual authority, measured delivery that breaks into urgency during the attack sequence
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, tense intellectual rock building to violent attack sequence, Honor's Theme echoed from Dalinar's unite-them on distant choir, rising chromatic stormwall motif for the assassination attack, dramatic female vocals, orchestral arrangements, concept album continuity, theatrical, apparent death scene
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The Parshendi, the Parshmen, all the same,
An ancient people wearing different names,
The Voidbringers were never some dark race,
They were the ones we kept in servile place.

[verse 2]
I told Dalinar, sent the evidence,
But will he listen? Will it make a dent?
"Unite them," said the voice in his visions' light,
But unity means seeing with new sight.

[chorus]
My ivory tower crumbles, stone by stone,
The truth I've found means I cannot atone
For what we've done, for how we've lived this lie,
And someone on this ship wants me to die.

[bridge]
The blade comes in the dark, the assassins' creep,
I Soulcast air to smoke but the cut is deep,
The stormwall of betrayal, steel and night,
And Jasnah Kholin falls from mortal sight.

[verse 3]
But scholars do not die so easily,
I pull myself through pain to Shadesmar's sea,
A realm of thought where flesh can still endure,
If you are cold enough, if you are sure.

[outro]
They'll think I'm dead, let them believe the tale,
The ivory tower stands beyond the veil.

tracks.title: Shadesmar
tracks.voice_instruct: A commanding, precise female mezzo-soprano navigating alien landscape, cool intellectual delivery with growing wonder and isolation
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, ambient progressive rock with inverted stormwall motif rising from ground on reversed strings, Honor's Theme as compass on solo cello, otherworldly synth pads and bead-ocean sound design, atmospheric female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, Shadesmar exploration
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
An ocean made of beads, a sky of black,
No sun, no stars, no way of going back,
The spren here walk like people, tall and strange,
And I am mortal, fragile, out of range.

[verse 2]
Ivory, my spren, a figure wrought of ink,
He guides me past the places where I'd sink,
"The perpendicularity," he says, "will lead you home,"
But it's a world away through cognitive foam.

[chorus]
Shadesmar, the mind behind the mask,
Where every object answers if you ask,
I walk the realm of thought without a map,
And the stormwall here inverts, a thunder-clap
That rises from the ground into the air,
A scholar lost but never in despair.

[bridge]
Honor's theme is my compass, faint but true,
A melody that tells me what to do,
Keep walking, Jasnah, logic is your blade,
The world needs what the scholar's mind has made.

[verse 3]
Weeks become a blur, the landscape shifts,
I trade with spren, I navigate the rifts,
And slowly, slowly, I can feel the seam
Between the worlds, the edge of waking dream.

[outro]
Shadesmar is a mirror, dark and deep,
But Jasnah Kholin does not fall asleep.

tracks.title: The Kill List
tracks.voice_instruct: A haunted, controlled male tenor with Middle Eastern inflections, mechanical and emotionless delivery as if the humanity has been drained out, precise and cold
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, mechanical industrial rock with relentless distorted industrial Thrill riff as mechanical heartbeat, drop-tuned bitcrushed power chord, glitched percussion, complete absence of Honor's Theme, robotic precision in rhythm, haunted male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, assassination montage
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
A list of names, each written clean and clear,
The highprinces of Roshar, the kings of fear,
My masters say to cut them, one by one,
Until the constellation's come undone.

[verse 2]
I walk through walls, I walk on ceilings high,
Each Lashing makes the gravity comply,
They send their guards, their Shardbearers, their best,
And one by one, I put them all to rest.

[chorus]
The kill list, the kill list, name by name,
Each face a stranger, each death just the same,
The Thrill, a heartbeat, mechanical and cold,
I am a weapon, doing what I'm told.

[bridge]
No honor here, no melody, no hymn,
Just silence in the places growing dim,
I am the Assassin in White, they say,
And Szeth-son-Vallano dies a bit each day.

[verse 3]
Taravangian gave the order, drew the plan,
A diagram of murder, spoke the man,
"For the good of all, these leaders have to fall,"
And I obey, because I'm nothing, nothing at all.

[outro]
The kill list shortens, but the dead remain,
A truthless man, dissolving in the rain.

tracks.title: The Rift
tracks.voice_instruct: A deep, commanding male bass-baritone consumed by horror at his own past, the voice of a man remembering the worst thing he ever did, raw and unguarded
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, devastating heavy rock with distorted industrial Thrill riff dominating entire track as Nergaoul corruption motif, fire-as-stormwall with ascending chromatic phrase, massive wall of sound, agonized male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the Blackthorn's worst memory
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The city of the Rift, they would not kneel,
I brought the army, brought the blood and steel,
My wife said, "Mercy," and I heard the word,
But the Thrill was louder, louder than a bird
Could scream, louder than a mother's prayer,
I gave the order and I burned the air.

[verse 2]
The fires climbed like storms against the walls,
And somewhere in the screaming, someone calls
My name, but I am lost inside the red,
The mist of hunger, painting everything in dead.

[chorus]
The Rift, the Rift, I burned it to the ground,
My wife inside it, and I heard the sound
Of everything I loved becoming ash,
The Thrill released me, and I felt the crash.

[bridge]
The heartbeat, drums, the distorted chord,
The Thrill like a god I'd chosen to be lord,
It gave me Rathalas in ruins, smoke, and bone,
And left me standing, utterly alone.

[verse 3]
I cannot remember, Cultivation took the price,
She carved my wife from memory like ice,
But the guilt remains without a name or face,
A void where Evi was, an empty space.

[outro]
The Rift still burns in every dream I find,
The Blackthorn's sin, forever in his mind.

tracks.title: The Shattered Sword
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor dropping his usual swagger to become quiet and wondering, talking to something no one else can hear
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, atmospheric prog rock with dissonant Honor's Theme played slightly wrong and out of tune, haunting string arrangements suggesting something trapped, introspective male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, dead spren mystery
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Ten heartbeats, and the Blade appears in hand,
A weapon that the world can't understand,
But every time I call it, something screams,
A voice behind the metal, lost in dreams.

[verse 2]
The others never hear it, never feel
The sickness in the way these weapons deal
Their damage, cutting souls but leaving flesh,
There's something trapped inside this ancient mesh.

[chorus]
A shattered sword, a broken song inside,
A spren that died the day the Radiants lied,
I hold her in my hand, this nameless blade,
And wonder at the promise that was made
And broken, and I cannot look away,
From the scream that follows me through every fray.

[bridge]
A note of honor, but it's out of tune,
Like someone tried to play it to the moon
And missed, and now it echoes, wrong and wide,
A dissonance I carry by my side.

[verse 3]
"What's your name?" I whisper to the steel,
She cannot answer, dead spren cannot feel,
Or can they? Something flickers in the dark,
A memory, a ghost, the faintest spark.

[outro]
The shattered sword screams on, and Adolin holds tight,
Waiting for the dawn inside the night.
